intro: Isolepis striatella, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a perennial grass-like plant native to wetlands and marshy areas. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spike-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, thriving in temperate climates. Its root system helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion in wetland environments. Isolepis striatella plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
